thread.title: Myles Garrett asks Jerry Jones to pick him No. 1
thread.title_full: Myles Garrett asks Jerry Jones to pick him No. 1

author: USA TODAY
title: Myles Garrett asks Jerry Jones to pick him No. 1
text:
Myles Garrett asks Jerry Jones pick him No. 1 "Please ... make it happen." Post to Facebook Myles Garrett asks Jerry Jones pick him No. 1 "Please ... make it happen."  //ftw.usatoday.com/2017/02/myles-garrett-nfl-draft-no-1-jerry-jones-cowboys-romo-browns-please/   Join the Nation's Conversation To   Myles Garrett asks Jerry Jones pick him No. 1 Alysha Tsuji , USA TODAY 8:28 p.m. ET Feb. 10, 2017 
Myles Garrett really doesn't want to play for the Browns. (Photo: ESPN) 
Former Texas A&M defensive end Myles Garrett had a message meant for Dallas Cowboys owner Jerry Jones on Friday. The 21-year-old really wants to play for the Cowboys, and he has a plan on how the franchise can make it happen. He said in an ESPN video, with a smile: 
"I'm speaking to you Jerry. Listen, Mr. Garrett, make it happen. Dak Prescott is leading our team right now. I need you to take Tony Romo, take a couple picks and give 'em to Cleveland, so you can pick me up. Please. I'd love to play in Dallas. Make it happen." Projected #1 overall pick in the upcoming NFL Draft, Myles Garrett makes it known he wants to play for the #DallasCowboys pic.twitter.com/idyWFAEOfH â€” Chase Williams (@chasepwilliams) February 10, 2017 
The smile on his face suggests he knows exactly how much of a long shot this is, but hey, it can't hurt, right? 
USA TODAY Sports' Nate Davis has projected Garrett to be picked No. 1 by the Cleveland Browns . 
But regardless of which team picks him, Garrett has already said he won't be at the draft. He told the Houston Chronicle he'll be at home with friends and family instead.
